topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547b4ddf636872547bf50000#post_547b4ddf636872547bf50000
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]So I read most of Boku no Hero Academia last night.
It's pretty good.[/bq]
Honestly I enjoy it so far. . . but I have reservations about it because I have a feeling it might turn out like bleach in that it starts out good and then goes to garbage cause the creators refuse to end it.  As long as it ends before say a hundred or hundred fifty chapters that's fine, but if it goes for seven hundred I would highly doubt it'll remain good.

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547b51c4636872092d7a0100#post_547b51c4636872092d7a0100
I never said I don't like all super hero mass media; rather I don't like the vast majority of them because the overwhelming majority of are so cheesy I can't stand it.  To give a example of what I mean take the 1960's tv show batman; it's so cheesy it should be considered torture.  Another example is Batman & Robin (1997); the only redeeming thing about the movie is Mr Freeze cause for one I like puns and two I like villains who are morally gray.  Say what you will about the movie the plot about him trying to save his wife was really the only good thing about the movie.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

"@xWoofyhoundx":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547b561e636872640b710200#post_547b561e636872640b710200
No, it's not that good. It's still more or less the same game, but I feel they added enough bells and whistles to the game to make the gameplay look fresh and new again.

I'd say, just from watching it, it's an 8.5/10 at least though.
